thread.title: Three Homes Fit for a President

author: Sandra Ward
title: Three Homes Fit for a President

organizations.name: supreme court and library of congress

text:
0 COMMENTS $2.05 million A Street SE
Five bedrooms, four bathrooms, one half-bath
This Victorian brick semidetached townhouse is three blocks from the Supreme Court and Library of Congress. The 3,988-square-foot, three-level home features 12-foot ceilings, ornate period moldings and a fireplace in the living room. A master suite with wood-burning fireplace commands the top floor. There is a side garden and pool.
Agent: Michael Schaeffer, Coldwell Banker
Photo: Chris Ellenbogen/HomeVisit (2) $1.225 million Kentucky Avenue SE
Four bedrooms, two bathrooms, one half-bath
This row house, blocks from Lincoln Park, features a backyard deck and garden accessed from the kitchen. There is a wood-burning fireplace in the living room. The 2,100-square-foot home has a large dining room. The basement level has a family room with a wet bar and a guest bedroom. There is a one-car garage.
Agent: Libby Clarke, Compass 
Photo: Jessica Overcash (2) $1.425 million 9th Street NE
Three bedrooms, two bathrooms, one half-bath
This Richardsonian Romanesque home, built in 1892, is nine blocks from the U.S. Capitol and four blocks to the Eastern Market. The stone facade and outside architectural details are original. The formal parlor on the second floor has a fireplace. Sliders in the dining room lead to a garden and a lawn with a brick patio. 
Agent: Todd Bissey, Compass 
More Relative Values
